description: From pains +‎ taking; see take pains. The /ˈpeɪnˌsteɪkɪŋ/ pronunciation which dominates in the United States suggests a reanalysis of the word as pain +‎ staking.

adjectives.description: painstaking (comparative more painstaking, superlative most painstaking)

entries.meaning: Carefully attentive to details; diligent in performing a process or procedure.
examples: All these painstaking men, considered together, may be said to have completed another species of criticism.

entries.meaning: The application of careful and attentive effort.
examples: It is not by a flight of imagination that you gain the ascents of spiritual experience. It is by the toils and the watchings and the painstakings of a solid obedience.
